Topic.Title: An Iranian origin directing Mars mission at the USA NASA, am proud of him

Message.Msg: Bobak Ferdowsi, who is flight director on the Mars Science Laboratory Curiosity mission, attracted a good deal of attention for his haircut, a shaven, stars and red dye combo which has earned him the moniker Mohawk Guy. According to AP, Ferdowsi cuts his hair differently for every mission, and the latest style seems to have turned him into something of a heart-throb. "Cute, stylish AND brilliant!" tweeted one woman, while a man blogging about the landing mission on tumblr wrote: "Bobak Ferdowsi is the new standard of attractiveness. Good looking and smart. Us male-folk are screwed." from Ghormeh Sabzi 06-Aug-2012

Topic.Title: An Iranian origin directing Mars mission at the USA NASA, am proud of him

Message.Msg: Steally what? even though in some parts of Iran people also speak different languages, but Farsi is Iranian national language. Funny as they might sound but they are true reports: Bobak Ferdowsi: NASA Mars Flight Director comments from from guardian, uk, ... [Bobak] Ferdowsi is of Persian descent, and many Persians and Persian-Americans have tweeted about him, saying how proud they are that he represents their community, providing a positive image of Iranian-Americans. "People enjoy being able to see someone like them doing great things like landing a robot on another planet using a crane and rockets" ----------- And what a shame that they let the ignorance rule the mind of ignorants: ?????? Apple Store In Georgia Refuses To Sell iPad, iPhone To Farsi-Speaking Customer, Citing Company Policy The Huffington Post | By Craig Kanalley Posted: 06/19/2012 4:01 pm Updated: 06/20/2012 A 19-year-old woman in Alpharetta, Ga., claims that her local Apple store refused to sell her anything after she was heard speaking Farsi with her uncle while she was trying to buy an iPhone and iPad. "When we said 'Farsi, I'm from Iran,' he said, 'I just can't sell this to you. Our countries have bad relations,'" Sahar Sabet told WSB-TV. According to the report, the Apple store employee cited the company's official policy, which prohibits the sale of their products to countries with which trade is prohibited by U.S. embargo. -------- Sabet, though, didn’t buy that explanation. In her opinion, she was racially profiled. “He didn’t have any business asking me what country I was from,” Sabet said. “I actually walked out in tears.” ??????
